title: AC Milan 'want Pep Guardiola to be their new manager despite only hiring Stefano Pioli LAST WEEK'
text:
AC Milan want to hire Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola for next season - just a week after naming Stefano Pioli - according to Mundo Deportivo.

The Spanish outlet states that the club's owners, Elliott Management, have become increasingly frustrated with results this season and the failure of recent managers over the last few seasons.

They therefore see the Catalan, who has a contract with Premier League champions City until 2021, as the perfect man to get them back on track both domestically and in Europe.

AC Milan are interested in hiring Pep Guardiola, according to Mundo Deportivo

However, the claims come just a week after Stefano Pioli was appointed to replace Marco Giampaolo, with the former now likely to be restricted to a caretaker role at the San Siro.

Guardiola has been linked with a move to Italy many times in the past and was also said to have been a contender for the Juventus job over the summer following the departure of Massimiliano Allegri.

The former Barcelona and Bayern Munich boss spent some of his playing career in Serie A with Brescia and Roma and would therefore have no problems in adapting to the league or with the language.

The claims come despite Milan hiring Stefano Pioli as manager just last week

Guardiola was linked with replacing Massimiliano Allegri as Juventus manager in the summer

Milan's hierarchy are also said to be irritated at directors Paolo Maldini and Zvonimir Boban, believing that both lack the necessary experience and are only in the role due to their success with the club as players.

Their number one target to replace the duo, according to Mundo Deportivo, would be current Ajax director of sport Overmars.

However, the former Arsenal forward extended his contract to June 2024 with the Dutch club in March after helping them reach the Champions League semi-finals last season.

The hierarchy are also said to be irritated at directors Zvonimir Boban (left) and Paolo Maldini
description: AC Milan have their eyes on Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola, according to Mundo Deportivo. They want to hire the Catalan despite appointing Stefano Pioli as the new manager last week.
